verses.roman:
so 'patad bhuvi nirbhinna-
lalāṭo 'sṛk samutsṛjan
muñcann ārta-svaraṁ śailo
yathā vajra-hato 'ruṇaḥ

synonyms: saḥ—he, Balvala; apatat—fell; bhuvi—to the ground; nirbhinna—cracked open; lalāṭaḥ—his forehead; asṛk—blood; samutsṛjan—gushing; muñcan—releasing; ārta—of agony; svaram—a sound; śailaḥ—a mountain; yathā—like; vajra—by a lightning bolt; hataḥ—struck; aruṇaḥ—reddish.
translation: Balvala cried out in agony and fell to the ground, his forehead cracked open and gushing blood. He resembled a red mountain struck by a lightning bolt.

purport.content: According to the ācāryas, the demon appeared reddish with blood, like a mountain red with oxide.
